channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024041257
item.description:
Report X-2024041257

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. Upon examination, it was discovered that the content had a loose cap, leading to a leakage that spread across the other bottles.

item.title: Report X-2024041183
item.description:
Report X-2024041183

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained six glass bottles packaged with an egg crate top and bottom. Two of the bottles were broken spilling all contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found at the 100 vanline wet from leaking bag of Pro Strip DescribePack: Failure occurred at the internal bag that was punctured allowing liquid to leak out DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in a spill kit and taken to the HazMat cage to isolate and await processing

item.title: Report X-2024040821
item.description:
Report X-2024040821

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage. When it was discovered that the product inside contained regulated material, it was quickly transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: The top of the box was mildly soaked, the jerrican's sealant was defective and resulted in a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024040881
item.description:
Report X-2024040881

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package discovered 2 days after damage event and found to be improperly repacked. Upon inspection of repacked contents, the volume on one plastic jug of all purpose cleaner is lower than the other three. Based on prior experience, it is concluded that this one jug had a loose cap which allowed leaking. It then caused the outer box to mottle and corrode. Cap is found to be on tightly inside repack box. No further leaking observed. DescribePack: Unable to comply. Package was improperly repacked and no Hazmat Damage reporting was conducted at the time of the incident. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Cap tightened. All caps double checked for secure closure.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 6th a package was discovered during the PM sort. The package was marked as UN3090 Lithium Metal Batteries, 9, however the package was destroyed during shipping. The batteries that were inside the package were not damaged. The package was placed into a salvage drum and is pending disposition.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Sequence of event unknown due to lack of communication from sort in which incident happened. DescribePack: Package failed due to bottom of pail cracking causing contents to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting package in an open content bin and leaving it for OB QA to process.

item.title: Report X-2024040780
item.description:
Report X-2024040780

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: A package was discovered to be leaking at the unloading area. Upon inspection, it was determined that one out of four one-gallon bottles had a loose cap, resulting in the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024040614
item.description:
Report X-2024040614

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-06
  • City: CLARKSVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking by driver when he was going to load the package. QA called PDM Kayla Hoback to inspect package after seeing it was a HazMat. Kayla put PPE on and moved package to hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: Upon inspection, the package was found with a small leak appearing to be coming from one of the gallons of corrosive liquid. It appears that one of the caps failed and allowed it to leak. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately segregated and put in HazMat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024040612
item.description:
Report X-2024040612

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • City: NASHVILLE

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The leaking package was placed in a tote and left at the HWPA. No other information was provided. DescribePack: The damaged bottle was badly dented, causing a pinhole leak in the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a tote with an absorbent pad. PPE was worn while handling and processing.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was left in a tote at the HWPA for evaluation. No other information is available. DescribePack: The plastic drum is cracked down the side. The outer carton was lightly crushed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in front of the exhaust hood while processing. Gloves were worn while handling and cleaning the spillage. Most spillage was contained in the outer carton.

item.title: Report X-2024040708
item.description:
Report X-2024040708

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Conductor reported strong smell of sulfur in the area near the car. Car isolated. Contractor called to respond with H2S meter. Investigation revealed leakage around the manwy cover. Manway was opened and contractor found shipper had placed several gaskets on top of each other, rather than removing the old gaskets. Contractor removed old gaskets and found the original flat gasket still in the manway cover. This gasket was used to seal the car. Once manway bolts tightened, there was no detect on the meter around the manway.
